author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Piedmont men's soccer claims 2-0 win
text:
Monday October 19th, 2015 10:53PM 9:59PM ( 54 minutes ago ) News Alert Posted 11:44AM on Monday 19th October 2015 ( 11 hours ago ) Piedmont men's soccer claims 2-0 win By AccessWDUN Staff Related Articles UNG's Acimovic chosen as Peach Belt men's soccer Player of the Week Reich Earns USA South Rookie of the Week for Fifth Time in 2015 Lady Lions crush Berea, 6-0 UNG women's soccer overpowers Motevallo, 4-1 
DEMOREST — Stepping out of conference play to host Berea College for Senior Day at Walker Athletic Complex, the Piedmont College men's soccer team shutout the Mountaineers 2-0 with a pair of second half goals on Sunday afternoon. 
The two were scoreless after a fairly even first half, but Piedmont took control in the second half outshooting the Mountaineers ten to four down the stretch as Piedmont put six of its 14 shots in the game on target. 
The Lions' first goal came on a free kick by Chase Kane who slotted away his 6th goal of the season on the set piece opportunity just at the top of the penalty box. Kane's score handed Piedmont a 1-0 advantage with under 20 minutes to play, but it was a Cristian Alegria score just seconds later that sealed the deal as he found the back of the net to double the lead for the 2-0 win. 
Senior goalkeeper Kenneth Hearn picked up the clean sheet in goal on Senior Day as he was honored with three of his classmates just prior to kickoff. Associated Tags : college soccer, Piedmont men's soccer © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
